displayName.text: The Washington by LuxUrban, Trademark Collection by Wyndham

formattedAddress: 8 Albany St, New York, NY 10006, USA

authorAttributions.displayName: The Washington by LuxUrban, Trademark Collection by Wyndham

adrFormatAddress: 8 Albany St, New York, NY 10006, USA

editorialSummary.text: Sleek quarters in a premium hotel offering a restaurant & a gym, plus a terrace with city views.

originalText.text:
We stayed here for one week. We've had a breathtaking view to the 9/11-memorial and the One World Trade Center which made me really looking like for hours out of the window at any day or nighttime.

The service was good. All stuff members were very friendly and made some jokes. So nothing bad to mention from this side. Once we had a problem with the sink but the service was done the next day.

The rooms are comfortable and okay, could have been a bit more clean, especially the with walls were a bit used.

We have booked no breakfast. Besides that the hotel stopped offering breakfast few days ago.

originalText.text: Absolutely loved our stay at The Washington. Our family stayed at this hotel for one week over the Christmas holiday and can’t say enough good things about it. The cleanliness of the rooms and hospitality was superb! The view to the 9/11 hotel was beautiful and at night during Christmas it is breathtaking. It’s convenient to so many things and walk one block over and the train station is right there. Loved the friendliness of the housekeeping!

text.text: Absolutely loved our stay at The Washington. Our family stayed at this hotel for one week over the Christmas holiday and can’t say enough good things about it. The cleanliness of the rooms and hospitality was superb! The view to the 9/11 hotel was beautiful and at night during Christmas it is breathtaking. It’s convenient to so many things and walk one block over and the train station is right there. Loved the friendliness of the housekeeping!

originalText.text: If you get lucky, you'll get a view of the 911 memorial, which is definitely a highlight seeing as it's not the most expensive hotel you'll come across in the city. The rooms themselves have an avant garde feel about them, but we thought the low light they offer is more to mask the cheap finish than it is to create ambiance. Apart from that, you can't complain - it does everything a hotel for this price needs to do. Location excellent - the subway is right there & food choices are endless.

text.text: If you get lucky, you'll get a view of the 911 memorial, which is definitely a highlight seeing as it's not the most expensive hotel you'll come across in the city. The rooms themselves have an avant garde feel about them, but we thought the low light they offer is more to mask the cheap finish than it is to create ambiance. Apart from that, you can't complain - it does everything a hotel for this price needs to do. Location excellent - the subway is right there & food choices are endless.

originalText.text: Over all the building looks okay from the outside, the rooms are extremely out dated,  they don't have luggage carts so if you're like me and need a pregnancy pillow and a few other extra items, good luck getting them up and down without problems. The electric door kept locking so people couldn't get into the hotel.  For beinf pet friendly this absolutely no where to take your dog wirhout walking 5 blocks. The staff is pretty friendly. But I would not stay here again

The electric door kept locking so people couldn't get into the hotel.  For beinf pet friendly this absolutely no where to take your dog wirhout walking 5 blocks. The staff is pretty friendly. But I would not stay here again

originalText.text: We stayed in a corner king room, which was spacious, especially  for New York, and had a gorgeous view of the 9/11 memorial. The room was a bit dated and could've used some TLC (bathroom door didn't slide well, etc), but it was really clean. The lobby was really interesting with all the art, and it had a lot of space to lounge. We had booked a room that included breakfast, which they stop serving before our stay (without mentioning it to us at all). We had prepaid for the room that included breakfast, but they didn't mention anything when we checked in. I saw on a flyer in the lobby later that they stopped serving it, and when I asked the front desk they said all they could do was refund us $16 total for the discontinuation, but the difference in the rate we prepaid was more than that, so it didn't really make up for anything. The location was great though, surrounded by restaurants and an easy walk to wall street and battery park. There is even a restaurant and bar on the first floor (hotel lobby is fifth floor, so no worries about noise).
